newsitem.title: JAPAN: Japanese princess keen to visit French chateau.
newsitem.headline: Japanese princess keen to visit French chateau.

text.p: Japan's Princess Sayako, speaking to reporters about her trip to Europe next week, said on Friday she is especially looking forward to visiting a French chateau.
"I'm looking forward to tasting wine as I will be visiting a chateau in Bordeaux," Sayako, 28, told a news conference at her residence in Tokyo.
The soft-spoken princess, youngest child of Emperor Akihito and Empress Michiko, will make an official visit to France and the Netherlands from May 9 to 19.
French President Jacques Chirac extended the invitation to the Japanese royal family during his visit to Japan last November.
Sayako said her parents and brothers told her of their visits to Europe and gave her materials to read to prepare for the visit.
The Imperial Household Agency denied media reports that Sayako is making the trip in place of Crown Prince Naruhito and Princess Masako.
The reports said the couple cancelled their trip due to Masako's possible pregnancy.
"We've denied the reports. President Chirac extended the invitation to members of the royal family, and it so happened that Princess Sayako was to go," said a spokesman for the agency.
"There was no original plan to have the crown prince and princess visit France," he said.
Japanese media have reported that Princess Masako may be pregnant as she has more than once cancelled her official duties due to "illnesses".
